reviews.text: The Kendall is located in an old firehouse in Cambridge, Mass - just on the edge of the MIT campus. We had tickets to the theater in Boston, and we booked to stay overnight after the show. The location is perfect - just down the street from the Kendall/MIT T-stop and a few stops from the Theater district. Parking was included and is very convenient. The staff were friendly, accessible and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful unique hotel close to Boston

likes.liked: — Unique and friendly atmosphere...not a box hotel

reviews.title: Loved the Kendall
reviews.text: The hotel is charming, warm & inviting. The lobby has several cozy spots to sit and chat with frineds, some close to a fireplace. There is a small bar in the lobby. Breakfast is included and is terrific. In addition to the usual bacon, eggs and fruit, there were terrific pancakes and scones. Best of all, the coffee was wonderful. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bathrooms are spotless. This is a real find for a terrific price.

reviews.title: Very unpleasant experience
reviews.text: Finally, there is a local shuttle that runs to Cambridge Side Mall for great shopping, quick dining.

We stayed at the Kendall over Thanksgiving (2 nights) and loved every minute of our time there. Check in was quick and I was so pleased to step into our large, comfortable and nicely decorated room. And most importantly, it was so CLEAN! The bathroom was immaculate, like it was brand new. I am a very fussy person and this hotel lived up to my expectations. I didnt sleep so well as our room was adjacent to the elevator but it wasn't a huge problem, because it was otherwise the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. The free buffet breakfast was delicious, with pancakes, bacon and eggs, fruit salad and FRESH orange juice. I do recommend you get down there early though, as there was a line at about 9.30am when we ate. I can't believe such a great hotel with free breakfast could be so affordable. The location is also excellent - right next to the T stop, and only a couple of stops into the heart of Boston. I am going to insist that all my friends stay at this hotel when visiting Boston!
reviews.title: Very original, I loved it

likes.liked: — fun and different from chain hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fire alarm fired up at 2Am and all guests had to stay outside at freezing temperature in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Fine, until we got home

likes.disliked: — being accused of theft by the hotel

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived until we actually left Boston, we could honestly say the Kendall Hotel was fantastic. We arrived super early to Boston (around 11:30am) so we knew our room wouldn't be ready for us. The staff at the Kendall Hotel gladly held our bags so we could take advantage of our sightseeing. It was great that the T was only a block away making it super convenient to come and go.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay at the Kendall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to the hotel that evening at 10:30pm and were greeted by the front desk person. He was great in telling us all of the features of the hotel along with when breakfast would be served. We grabbed our bags and headed upstairs. We were a bit hesitant to be located right next to the elevator but it actually didn't bother us all night, maybe because we had the air conditioner on, who knows. The bed was quite comfy and the decor very New England. We had a bit of trouble figuring out the AC but eventually managed to get it to be comfortable enough to sleep all night with it on (not too cold, not too hot).
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: In the morning we were surprised to have such a yummy breakfast with eggs, bacon, pancakes, fruit salad, muffins, coffee and juice. We also had a complimentary newspaper which was nice to look at while eating breakfast. We checked out and once again the hotel held our bags since our bus back home wasn't until 5:30pm so we could do some more sightseeing.
reviews.title: Terrible Front Desk Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it was a very nice stay. I would recommend it to anyone and will definitely stay here again when I go back to Boston.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: First and foremost the hotel is easy to get to and has immediate access to the T (1/2 block away). Parking was not an issue with an under-hotel garage (we paid $7/night when we made the reservation).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Failure to provide room as reserved, with 2 beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Full breakfast was included. Great location near the T-stop and quick to Cambridge or Boston. Rooms were pleasant.
reviews.title: Great location and value during the winter months

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a real gem in the heart of Cambridge. The rooms are spacious, quiet, clean, reasonably priced and comfortable. What more could you ask for? Breakfast is good and service was unintrusive and polite. Right next to MIT and a T station, with pleasant walks, restaurants and shopping malls in th area. We'd stay again.
reviews.title: Loved the Kendall
Charming boutique hotel
reviews.text: Funky hotel with clean oddly-shaped rooms, nice amenities, free internet, great breakfast included in the price. Wonderful location too. We go to Mass General Hospital, and if you have to go to Mass Genl, this is a really great place to stay. I rated it above average and would have called it excellent except my wife was less enthusiastic about it-- I think because of the management's favor for rich paint colors. Takes all kinds.

reviews.title: Great choice!
reviews.text: Very high recommendation.

reviews.title: Lovely!
reviews.text: We booked the Kendall Hotel through Priceline, and were pleasantly surprised by our accomodations in relation to the price we paid. ($115.00) The hotel was nicely furnished, our room was spacious and quite clean, and the morning breakfast more than adequate. (Especially the fresh squeezed O.J.) The location in Cambridge is two doors down from the train station, restaurants nearby are abundant and the walk to Harvard Square was a mile or so. We will definitely stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Kendall. The hotel was charming. Spotless and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: wonderful staff

reviews.text: But the best part of the hotel is the staff. On the airplane I noticed that I had lost my wedding ring. On our return to Toronto we called the hotel and asked them to look for it. Two days later I was surprised to receive a call from the Kendall. My ring had been found in the laundry chute.
reviews.title: Felt like Home. Cozy Warm Hotel.

likes.disliked: — Internet PC was down once in a while.

reviews.text: We arranged to have the ring shipped to our home. And the ring is now on my finger.
reviews.title: Loved the Kendall!

reviews.text: A beautiful little hotel. 7 Floors, each with a unique feel. I stayed in Room 703 (Top floor facing the front of the hotel). Ceiling was very high and there was a warm country home feeling to the room. Complete with all amenities including an iron & ironing board... plus little chocolates. I managed to miss my flight back due to a snow storm and the front desk was very open to adding another night to my stay. I would recommend using Expedia to book the rooms as it charged $120 (all taxes included) versus booking directly with the hotel $159 plus taxes. The second room was 315 in the brand new wing of the hotel. This room was equiped with a LCD TV and the room was immaculate. Furnishings and fixtures were sparkling new. It overlooked the front of the hotel. Please refer to my pictures. I WILL Stay here again on my next visit to Boston. Oh, they serve free breakfast filled with fruits, eggs, bacon, pancakes and a few other things.
reviews.title: A great find!

likes.liked: — Fire house theme - it's nicely done but not overwhelming.

reviews.text: Only a 1 minute walk from the Kendall/MIT Red Line. Easy transfer to the Silver Line (Bus) for the Boston Airport.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Unique, beautiful rooms and hotel. Good location. Free internet. Quiet and very clean.
likes.disliked: — No on site fitness center--but not a huge deal.
